title: The Perfect Vacation: A Two Way Table
question_text:
At a travel expo, $180$ women and $180$ men were randomly selected to be surveyed. From a list of $7$ options, each individual was asked to identify where they would go for "the perfect vacation". The results of the survey are displayed below.
WomenMen
Beach5541
Mountains2635
City3328
Country1723
Theme Park2128
National Park914
Cruise1911


If an individual who was surveyed said their perfect vacation would be at the beach or on a cruise, what is the probability that the individual surveyed was a woman?
